intro: Hypsela oligophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hypsela, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming during the wet season. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils, allowing it to thrive in shaded, moist environments. Due to habitat loss, Hypsela oligophylla is considered critically endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
